reviews.review_msg: Grace, why did you give us two midterms, a final 8 page paper, a final exam and a group project/debate in the same class? And why are you so boring? And you made your obscure textbook (aka unpirateable) (that you wrote) required reading? We have to pay you too? Why are all the test questions so backward and inappropriate for testing?

Dont be fooled by these reviews, Grace is a really good, caring & understanding Prof. Although worthy quite a lot, The class paper was really easy to do as it didnt have a lot of constraints and had a clear outline. The exams are VERY fair so long as you come to class and glance at teh readings. You'll do well! Very chill class, would recommend.

Grace is caring and approachable. Readings are not necessary and tests were heavily based on the lectures. Heavily weighted assignments due within a short time-frame. The lecture material itself is interesting and the course is organized but the expectations are not quite clear despite having a rubric.

Not very happy with this professor. She does not seem to be very involved with the course. The class is based around debates and we are expected to learn off of her recorded lectures. The term paper was very confusing and messy, I spent a lot of time wondering if I had even done it right. I have read that her TA's for the course mark very hard too
Her lectures are interesting and easy to follow with up-to-date information on all of the topics. Takes interest in her students and takes time to respond to emails and questions in class.

Grace is very nice and knowledgeable, however, class is TERRIBLY ORGANIZED. Papers harshly marked by TA and these count for 40%.. Lectures filled with anecdotes unrelated to class, and UNRELATED to exams in terms of level difficulty. I regret taking the course. Curving system is messed up too. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

-lectures disorganized and rushed over slides -exams did not match class material and paper marked hard with inconsistencies with rubric -BEWARE OF TEXTBOOK- Grace's txt is required but only 5 chapters for 13wk semester assigned- I had success without use -lots of readings on canvas from other sources -SUPER short exams- MINIMAL ROOM FOR ERROR -
I really enjoyed this class, I found the lecture content very interesting and relevant to my life. Prof answers emails promptly and is accessible outside of class.
My favourite course I've taken in university so far. Really enjoyed the material and thought put into this course.

LOVED this course and the guest lectures for this class. I do not understand how people would think this class is difficult especially when the tests are open book and the lectures are recorded. Tests were fair and we were provided with ample resources and guidelines for the final paper. Some people really just love to complain...

I read these reviews before taking the course with Vanessa and was hoping that she wouldn't be as bad as people were saying. I do not recommend unless it is the only class you are taking. She expects way too much, reads off of a script, and can not answer questions without looking them up. Good luck to anyone who has no choice but to take her class

Pacing was an issue and the class often very chaotic due to it. Very specific criteria for paper and marked a little harsh. Not a terrible class but I wouldnt take a class with her in person without the ability to go back and watch lectures to pause to take notes. Favourite thing about this class was the guest speakers.

Very nitpicky criteria for all assignments, quizzes, and exams - if you don't use her exact wording, you don't get marks! Extremely dry lectures with tons of material and she moves at speed, so it can be hard to keep up. High expectations of students that she consistently fails to meet herself by making many mistakes - would highly suggest avoiding

I don't know why Vanessa has such bad reviews, people just love to complain. I was in the PSYC groupchat and people were just complaining about things that you really shouldn't be whining about for a 3rd year course. I was genuinely so appalled. It was also her first term teaching, so cut her a little bit of slack. I genuinely loved her as a prof

Vanessa's only flaw was her inexperience, but that will improve with time. She genuinely cares about the students and is always willing to meet outside of class time to make sure you properly understand the concepts. She took feedback about herself and the course really seriously, and even extended a paper deadline when students requested it.

Absolutely loved all the guest lectures and the relevance of the lecture material to everyday life. You must take detailed notes, she will make you work very hard for your marks. I did poorly on the first exam but improved drastically after attending office hours and taking better notes.

I liked Vanessa's teaching style, and the course content was interesting, but the EXAMS. If you want to pass them you HAVE to go to the review session, and you need to memorize her words from the lectures. Tests are all short answer and you have to use her exact words and phrasing to get marks. her expectations for the exams were totally unclear

Very interesting lectures although some topics were a bit dry at the beginning of the course. She is very accessible and caring and met with me for an hour outside of class time to give feedback on my paper and writing in general. Term tests were tough but fair and came straight from lectures/readings. Highly recommend attending office hours!
The course material itself was somewhat interesting but prof and the ta makes it extremely hard. Term paper also had nothing to do with the course content

Probably one of my least favourite lecturers I've had. Lectures were confusing and assignment criteria were also not clear. Very strict on APA7 (even though the uni has not released their APA 7 how to). Exams were very difficult as she expected everyone to memorize her lectures but it was close book. lectures frequently went over the 3 hours

Very dissapointed with this class. Term paper (30%) did not teach you anything about developmental disabilities, it focused on methodology and critiquing it which was useless for this class. Expectations for the exam were crazy. 8 q's, 10 marks each but she expected you to memorize her lectures word for word even tho the exam was closed book Avoid
